references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of "fairlets" for achieving fairness in clustering, a fundamental concept that influences many other works in the field.
This paper provides general algorithms for fair clustering, addressing various fairness objectives and offering a comprehensive approach to the problem.

references.paper_title: On the cost of essentially fair clusterings
references.reason: This paper analyzes the trade-off between fairness and clustering quality, providing theoretical results that establish fundamental limitations and complexities.

references.paper_title: Fair clustering under a bounded cost
references.reason: This paper offers algorithms that optimize clustering cost while satisfying fairness constraints, providing a practical approach to achieving both objectives.

references.paper_title: On the approximability of trade-offs and optimal access of web sources
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical foundation for understanding the approximability of multi-objective optimization problems, which is highly relevant to the fairness-quality trade-off in clustering.
